title: How to Close a Wattpad Account

steps.title: Go to https://www.wattpad.com/home and log in.
steps.content: Go to https://www.wattpad.com/home and log in. You can use any desktop computer web browser to close your account including Chrome, Safari, and Firefox. You can't use the app or a mobile browser to close your account.

steps.title: Click your username.
steps.content: Click your username. It's in the top right corner of the web browser and will prompt a menu to drop down. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . You'll see this near the bottom of the menu. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Close Account.
steps.content: Click Close Account . It's a red button on the right side of the "Settings" page. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Fill in the required information.
steps.content: Fill in the required information. You'll have to select a reason to explain why you're leaving and type a response to "What could we have done better". That information is mandatory for a few reasons: to give Wattpad a better picture of what makes users leave and to show that it's really you closing the account instead of a bot.

steps.title: Click to check the box next to "Yes, I'm sure.
steps.content: Click to check the box next to "Yes, I'm sure. Please close my account." It's a checkbox below the mandatory fields. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Enter your password.
steps.content: Enter your password. This is to further verify that you're closing the account instead of someone else.

steps.title: Click Close Account.
steps.content: Click Close Account . You'll be able to click on this once you finish filling in everything else on the page. [5] X Research source Sign in with your username and password again and the account will be reactivated. Don't sign in to see if your account has been closed because signing in will reactivate it again. Instead, go to https://www.wattpad.com/user/yourusername (insert your Wattpad username at the end of that link in place of "yourusername") and look for the "User not found" message. [6] X Research source
